question: Question_01_(f)
statement:
Find the Laplace transform $X(s)$ of the solution to the initial value
problem $x''' + x = 0, \quad x(0) = 1, x'(0) = 2, x''(0) = 3$ (but
\textbf{do not} compute $x(t)$).
hints:
How does the \emph{n}-th derivative, \emph{x\textsuperscript{(n)}(t)}
transform for an arbitrary function \emph{x(t)}?
